intro: Pimelea ignota, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Scrubwax, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in various regions across southern Australia. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Pimelea ignota is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
